column9: Notes
Welcome!

Agenda


tags$strong(tags$em('Start by doing what is necessary; then do what is possible; and suddenly you are doing the impossible.'))

 ~ Francis of Assisi

Lesson: https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1XFU8nEpnvoJKES4SxO88L3ddqAtZtQTeEauLzQlFfXk/edit?usp=sharing

Recording of lesson: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1uZkvtsLROntRssNVBC5mptKdd1XloOls/view?usp=sharing

Repository: https://github.com/EmilyMarkowitz-NOAA/FishR101-WelcomeR

Download Repository: https://github.com/EmilyMarkowitz-NOAA/FishR101-WelcomeR/archive/main.zip

Open R Studio and check it out: 

1. R project

2. Keyboard shortcuts (Tools > Keyboard shortcuts)

3. Workflow (good file structure)- example

4. Basic math

5. Vectors, Matrices, Arrays, Lists, and Data Frames

6. Best Practices Review
tags$img(src = './images/RTheHero.png')

Resources

From the presentation:

1. Our Coding Club: https://ourcodingclub.github.io/tutorials.html

2. Wilson et al., 2017: Good enough practices in scientific computing: https://journals.plos.org/ploscompbiol/article?id=10.1371/journal.pcbi.1005510

3. Math functions in R (resource): https://www.guru99.com/r-functions-programming.html

4. Data Types in R: https://www.programcreek.com/2014/01/vector-array-list-and-data-frame-in-r/

Other great resources: 

1. [Textbook] Intro to R for Data Science (Hadley Wickham): https://r4ds.had.co.nz/index.html

2. [Textbook] Advanced R (Hadley Wickham): https://adv-r.hadley.nz/

3. R Cheatsheets: https://rstudio.com/resources/cheatsheets/

4. Jenny Bryan: what they forgot to teach you about R: https://rstats.wtf/index.html 

5. Interactive Learning in R: https://swirlstats.com/students.html 

6. Eric Dunford’s Intro to R course & slides: http://ericdunford.com/ppol670/ 

7. Our Coding Club: https://ourcodingclub.github.io/tutorials.html 

8. Swirl R Package: https://swirlstats.com/students.html

tags$em('You can not use #tidyverse without base R. It is not a dichotomy. Pick the tools that make you most effective.')

 ~ The Great Hadley Wickham, creater of Tidyverse

Recording of Lesson: https://drive.google.com/file/d/14qscFfcWZrWQjC6g2L0AQeq79CSEiq0h/view?usp=sharing

1. The importance of checking as you go. 

2. Loading libraries (e.g., tidyverse: install.packages() and library())

3. Best practices - ‘renv’ for managing packages

*Note that after this lessson we will be focusing on Tidy methods.

Resources

1. R Project: https://www.r-project.org/about.html

3. Tidyverse: https://www.tidyverse.org/

Guide: https://garthtarr.github.io/meatR/janitor.html#clean_names() 


5. renv package

Guide: https://rstudio.github.io/renv/articles/renv.html

column5: Let's Modularize! All Things If-Else Statements, For Loops, and Functions
column9:
Agenda

tags$strong(tags$em('If you have a difficult task to do, give it to a lazy man, he will find an easier way to do it.'))

 ~ Henry Ford, inventor of the production line and someone who probably would have been a programmer if he were alive to see computers.

Recording of Lesson: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1NfpvfN0loMe_GzSZ2iid55NBSfTKU4u7/view?usp=sharing

Repository Webpage: https://github.com/EmilyMarkowitz-NOAA/FishR101-Functions

Download Repository Content: https://github.com/EmilyMarkowitz-NOAA/FishR101-Functions/archive/main.zip

NOTE ABOUT LECTURE -- We only got through half the lecture, so do not no need to review any of the functions material. Funcitons will be covered next lesson!

1. Writing

2. Checking

3. Calling

4. Best practices  -roxygen2 documentation

5. Best Practices - Modular coding style
tags$img(src = './images/lightbulbfunction.jpg')

Resources

If-Else Statements

Fast and Readable If Else in R: https://tysonbarrett.com/jekyll/update/2019/10/16/filter_mutate_keep/

R if else elseif Statement: https://www.learnbyexample.org/r-if-else-elseif-statement/

R for Data Science - Chapter 19 covers functions and includes a section on if/else statements.: https://r4ds.had.co.nz/functions.html?q=else#functions

Data Quest - skip while section: https://www.dataquest.io/blog/control-structures-in-r-using-loops-and-if-else-statements/

For Loops

Data Camp: https://www.datacamp.com/community/tutorials/tutorial-on-loops-in-r

R for Data Science - Chapter 21 Iterations including for loops.: https://r4ds.had.co.nz/iteration.html?q=loop#iteration

DataCamp - beginning is helpful, skip apply functions: https://www.datacamp.com/community/tutorials/tutorial-on-loops-in-r

1. Conforming to a predictable script structure

2. Annotation

3. Never repeating code

7. Saving scripts in an “R Project
